body.p: The IASB began its discussion of the disclosure requirements necessary to meet the objectives by assessing the disclosure requirements in SIC‑28 Business Combinations—“Date of Exchange” and Fair Value of Equity Instruments and IAS 22. The IASB concluded that information disclosed in accordance with SIC‑28 about equity instruments issued as part of the cost of a business combination helped to meet the first of the three objectives outlined above. Therefore, IFRS 3 carried forward the disclosure requirements in SIC‑28.
